101CustomIZ1：光茵荏苒:
<size=18>Chapter 1: Lawn of Time



















Welcome to I, Zombie Puzzles! Please change the difficulty to the recommended one before playing for the best experience.
Your goal is to let the zombies eat all the brains at the end of each lane. Sunflowers and Twin Sunflowers drop Sun when eaten!
Chapter Maker: MirteorShower
102CustomIZ1-1:
<size=18>Lawn of Time 1-1



















Although we're in Fusion, let's start with something simple.
Can you beat this level containing only vanilla plants and vanilla zombies?
103CustomIZ1-2:
<size=18>Lawn of Time 1-2
<size=12><alpha=#03>Best Solution: 1200 Sun left
<size=6><alpha=#00>awa
<size=18><alpha=#FF>

















Hopefully the difficulty spike is not so terrible?
You can check the Almanac to learn more about the zombies' abilities and traits.
N.B.: Only Sunflowers and Twin Sunflowers drop Sun when eaten.
104CustomIZ1-3教程:
<size=18>Lawn of Time 1-3 Tutorial: Sunrise-shroom



















This is a tutorial level! In tutorial levels you have more than enough Sun and you can drop zombies anywhere you like!
The plant in the Pot on lane 3 is a Sunrise-shroom. It absorbs Sun dropped within a 5×5 area. And it keeps it, no refunds.
When you see Sunrise-shrooms, prioritize taking them out to avoid missing out on Sun!
105CustomIZ1-3:
<size=18>Lawn of Time 1-3
<size=12><alpha=#03>Best Solution: 950 Sun left
<size=6><alpha=#00>awa
<size=18><alpha=#FF>

















This level gives you two types of Pole Vaulting Zombies. The 75 Sun one is cheaper, but its HP is paper-thin.
Tip: You can toggle plant/zombie HP display on the pause menu. On PC, you can also press Q or W.
106CustomIZ1-4:
<size=18>Lawn of Time 1-4
<size=12><alpha=#03>Best Solution: 1100 Sun left
<size=6><alpha=#00>awa
<size=18><alpha=#FF>

















Sometimes it's just hard to stop Sunrise-shroom from stealing your Sun. Don't stress - losing a little is fine. Perfection isn't required.
Btw, even though Zombotanies can attack from afar, sometimes placing them right in a plant's face works better.
Stuck? You can raise the difficulty to give zombies damage reduction. (Try not to rely on that though.)
107CustomIZ1-5-1:
<size=18>Lawn of Time 1-5-1
<size=12><alpha=#03>Best Solution: 1025 Sun left
<size=6><alpha=#00>awa
<size=18><alpha=#FF>

















Welcome to 1-5! It's a series of levels.
Try placing Zombotanies from onto the Giga Mecha-nuts on the far right. They'll attack automatically.
Once a lane is cleared, drop a Pole Vaulting Zombie there to claim the brain. (You can enable fast-forward in the main menu.)
108CustomIZ1-5-2:
<size=18>Lawn of Time 1-5-2
<size=12><alpha=#03>Best Solution: 1075 Sun left
<size=6><alpha=#00>awa
<size=18><alpha=#FF>

















We've added an extra column of Pumpkin Mines on the right. Now you've got room to place those defensive Zombotanies.
You can stack multiple shooter Zombotanies on the same tile for some serious firepower.
Tip: If you see a plant you don't recognize, check the Almanac. On PC, hover over it and press C for a quick lookup.
109CustomIZ1-5-3:
<size=18>Lawn of Time 1-5-3
<size=12><alpha=#03>Best Solution: 900 Sun left
<size=6><alpha=#00>awa
<size=18><alpha=#FF>

















Mix and match your Zombotanies wisely and flatten that plant defense line!
And don't forget, take out those Sunrise-shrooms first.
Tip: Tap the Slow Mode button in the bottom-left (press 3 on PC) to slow things down and place multiple zombies more easily.
110CustomIZ1-6教程:
<size=18>Lawn of Time 1-6 Tutorial: Solar Squash 1



















After attacking, Solar Squash automatically consumes Sun to revive.
The more it revives the more Sun it needs. If you don't have enough Sun, it dies for good.
It's recommended to trigger its attack when your Sun is below 50 so it can't revive and won't cost anything extra.
Also, ranged attacks do NOT stop Solar Squash from reviving. Try placing a shooter Zombotany on lane 1 to see how it works.
111CustomIZ1-6:
<size=18>Lawn of Time 1-6
<size=12><alpha=#03>Best Solution: 775 Sun left
<size=6><alpha=#00>awa
<size=18><alpha=#FF>

















Before baiting those Solar Squashes, try to spend as much Sun as possible.
Of course you can also choose to sacrifice some Sun to raise its revival threshold - just don't overdo it.
Tip: Remember to use Slow Mode to quickly deploy zombies when needed.
112CustomIZ1-7教程:
<size=18>Lawn of Time 1-7 Tutorial: Solar Squash 2



















If Solar Squash lands on a tile already occupied by a plant, it won't revive - even if you have plenty of Sun. (See lane 3.)
There are still a few Solar Squashes left on the lawn. Use the zombies in your arsenal to deal with them as efficiently as possible.
(Want to skip the tutorial? Just drop zombies in column 1 and eat the brains directly.)
113CustomIZ1-7:
<size=18>Lawn of Time 1-7
<size=12><alpha=#03>Best Solution: 725 Sun left
<size=6><alpha=#00>awa
<size=18><alpha=#FF>

















Even more Solar Squashes! Hope you're ready. Don't forget the tricks you learned in 1-6 too.
Sometimes it's genuinely hard to make a Squash land exactly on another plant.
114CustomIZ1-8:
<size=18>Lawn of Time 1-8
<size=12><alpha=#03>Best Solution: 925 Sun left
<size=6><alpha=#00>awa
<size=18><alpha=#FF>

















Good news: This defense is made entirely of Sunflowers and their fusions.
Bad news: Both Sunrise-shroom and Solar Squashes are here too.
On the bright side, you've got a new zombie - Chicken Jockey. They're fast. Really fast. Great for baiting Squashes.
Tip: This level has some margin for error. Even if a bit of Sun gets wasted by Sunrise-shroom or Solar Squash, you can still win.
115CustomIZ1-9:
<size=18>Lawn of Time 1-9
<size=12><alpha=#03>Best Solution: 400 Sun left
<size=6><alpha=#00>awa
<size=18><alpha=#FF>

















Explosive cherries from Explode-o-shooter Zombies deal splash damage. Use that to hit lanes 2 and 4 in this level.
To make sure the Cherries explode in the right spot, you may need to use other zombies to help chip into the defense.
(You've seen Explode-o-shooter Zombie before, but this time the position of the explosion matters a lot more.)
116CustomIZ1-10教程:
<size=18>Lawn of Time 1-10 Tutorial: Solar Squash 3


















Some plants have very high HP and reduced damage from cherry blasts. You'll need multiple rounds
to take them down (like the Football Gatling in lane 2). By exploiting Solar Squash's revival mechanic,
you can trigger multiple cherry blasts on the same tile. (Be careful - this still costs Sun. Too many revivals = wasted Sun.)
In this tutorial, place an Explode-o-shooter Zombie on the Giga Mecha-nut in lane 3.
It will automatically take out the Football Gatling in lane 2.
117CustomIZ1-10:
<size=18>Lawn of Time 1-10
<size=12><alpha=#03>Best Solution: 575 Sun left
<size=6><alpha=#00>awa
<size=18><alpha=#FF>

















Uh… is that a Gatling Cherrybomber in the middle lane? And it brought backup??
Gatling Cherrybomber is immune to cherry blast damage. Try using splash to clear out the shooter plants behind it first.
Once its support is gone, the lone Gatling Cherrybomber isn't so scary anymore.
201CustomIZ2：菇泛远影:
<size=18>Chapter 2: Shroomshade



















Welcome to Chapter 2! This time you'll be facing off against all kinds of mushrooms - and taking them down.
You'll also unlock new zombies with more complex mechanics. Don't forget to check the Almanac if something confuses you.
Chapter Maker: MirteorShower
202CustomIZ2-1:
<size=18>Shroomshade 2-1
<size=12><alpha=#03>Best Solution: 950 Sun left
<size=6><alpha=#00>awa
<size=18><alpha=#FF>

















Up to 3 Puff-shrooms can stack on a single tile!
Individually their fusions might not look impressive compared to before,
but three together? That number's a problem.<size=6>
<size=12>And if they're mixed types… good luck.<size=18>
203CustomIZ2-2教程:
<size=18>Shroomshade 2-2 Tutorial: Scaredy-shroom



















Many Scaredy-shrooms have powerful ranged attacks. But if a zombie gets within a 3×3 area around them,
they panic and stop attacking. To exploit this, place a zombie in an adjacent lane first to make them hide, then deploy
zombies in their own lane. (See lanes 1 and 2.) This greatly reduces incoming damage and makes breaking through much easier.
204CustomIZ2-2:
<size=18>Shroomshade 2-2
<size=12><alpha=#03>Best Solution: 825 Sun left
<size=6><alpha=#00>awa
<size=18><alpha=#FF>

















Zombie Horseman moves fast and can instantly trample most plants it charges into, ignoring their HP. The catch?
It's not too bulky and it needs time to start moving again after a collision. Make sure it doesn't die before its attack connects.
Tip: Some Scaredy-shrooms attack in unusual ways. Check the Almanac for details.
205CustomIZ2-3:
<size=18>Shroomshade 2-3
<size=12><alpha=#03>Best Solution: 750 Sun left
<size=6><alpha=#00>awa
<size=18><alpha=#FF>

















There's an extra lane now! You'll need to eat all 6 brains to win.
A new mushroom appears: Wallop-shroom. It picks up nearby Nut-shrooms and fire them as high-damage shots.
They are sitting ducks if no Nut-shrooms are nearby. Taking out the little ones first might be the smart move.
206CustomIZ2-4:
<size=18>Shroomshade 2-4<size=12>
<alpha=#60>(Level made by 43056721, edited by MirteorShower)
<alpha=#04>Best Solution: 800 Sun left
<alpha=#00>.<alpha=#FF><size=18>

















If there are too many Nut-shrooms, you can actually turn Wallop-shroom's mechanic against them.
Try placing a Diamond-box Zombie in front of a Wallop-shroom to quickly clear out the annoying Nut-shrooms.
<size=6>
<size=15>(Downside: you'll have to sacrifice a Diamond-box Zombie for it… unless you figure out a smarter way to bait out those Wallop-shrooms).<size=18>
207CustomIZ2-5-1:
<size=18>Shroomshade 2-5-1
<size=12><alpha=#03>Best Solution: 900 Sun left
<size=6><alpha=#00>awa
<size=14><alpha=#FF>

















Welcome to 2-5. In these stages, you'll only have Football Knight Captain as your zombie. It's powerful across the board.
But here's the catch: he doesn't eat brains while mounting. You need plants to defeat the horse
and summon Giga Buckshot Commando before you can actually get the brain.
Still confused? Try placing an him in lanes 1, 3, and 5 and watch what happens.
(Remember to manually use and upgrade the Soot-shroom with Damage Upgrade.)
208CustomIZ2-5-2:
<size=18>Shroomshade 2-5-2
<size=12><alpha=#03>Best Solution: 550 Sun left
<size=6><alpha=#00>awa
<size=18><alpha=#FF>

















Nice work. You've probably noticed that some plants are TD plants and can be manually upgraded with Sun to boost their stats.
Upgrading is essential here. Without enough damage to knock down the Knight Captain, you won't clear the level.
<u>From now on, all upgradable plants are marked with a Solar Pot.</u> Choose wisely and which upgrade you need.
209CustomIZ2-5-3:
<size=18>Shroomshade 2-5-3
<size=12><alpha=#03>Best Solution: 1160 Sun left
<size=6><alpha=#00>awa
<size=18><alpha=#FF>
















<size=14>

<size=18>Overspending Sun early on upgrades can leave you broke later, so plan carefully.
The order of attack matters a lot in this level.
The right sequence can boost plant damage efficiency - and even help you earn Sun.



















<size=9>
210CustomIZ2-6教程:
<size=18>Shroomshade 2-6 Tutorial: Doom Chomper



















Doom Chomper destroys every plant directly in front of it when it attacks. Doesn't matter what or how many - all gone instantly.
You can deliberately feed it a zombie to trigger its attack and let it "betray" its own side for your gain.
(Don't drop multiple zombies at once if you plan on using it, though.
Doom-shroom explosions will also instantly wipe out most zombies.)
211CustomIZ2-6:
<size=18>Shroomshade 2-6<size=12>
<alpha=#60>(Level made by 43056721, edited by MirteorShower)
<alpha=#04>Best Solution: 800 Sun left
<alpha=#00>.<alpha=#FF><size=18>

















The Doom-shroom family may be short-lived, but they unleash overwhelming power in that brief moment.
Plants have stabilized this energy through fusion, but it's still volatile.
Make clever use of Doom Chomper's destructive power and blast your way to victory.
212CustomIZ2-7教程:
<size=18>Shroomshade 2-7 Tutorial: Doom Squash



















When Doom Squash lands, it triggers a Doom-shroom explosion at the impact tile.
The blast also instantly destroys plants. (See lane 1.) Unlike Doom Chomper, Doom Squash's landing spot can be controlled,
making its explosions much more flexible. Now place zombies in column 6 of lanes 3, 4, 5, and 6 in the order
shown in your arsenal. Doom Squash will automatically blow up those Flame Tall-nuts.
213CustomIZ2-7:
<size=18>Shroomshade 2-7
<size=12><alpha=#02>Best Solution: 700 Sun left
<size=6><alpha=#00>awa
<size=18><alpha=#FF>

















New zombie unlocked: Olympic Pole Vaulter. It jumps extremely far and, with enough run-up, can even ignore Tall-nuts.
If you want it to clear a Tall-nut, place it farther to the right to give it enough runway.
Note: The run-up only determines whether it can vault over a Tall-nut. It doesn’t change the jump distance itself.
214CustomIZ2-8教程:
<size=18>Shroomshade 2-8 Tutorial: Curse-shroom & Hypno Pumpkin
<size=12><alpha=#40>Place zombies in the leftmost column to skip this tutorial.
<alpha=#FF><size=0>
<size=18>

















When a zombie eats a Curse-shroom, it turns into a hypnotized zombie that explodes on death, which also destroys plants. (See lane 2.)
First, send a zombie to eat the Curse-shroom. When the hypnotized zombie reaches the Hypno Pumpkin, it'll be stuck in place.
Then send another zombie to kill it and trigger the explosion to destroy plants.
There's another Curse-shroom in the back of lane 5. Can you use it to blow up the Flame Wall-nut in column 5?



















<size=10>
215CustomIZ2-8:
<size=18>Shroomshade 2-8<size=12>
<alpha=#60>(Level made by 43056721, edited by MirteorShower)
<alpha=#04>Best Solution: 625 Sun left
<alpha=#00>.<alpha=#FF><size=18>

















A chaotic combo of various Doom fusions! Use a little <alpha=#80><s>friendly fire</s><alpha=#FF> wisely and things get much easier.
You also have Frost Tall-nut Zombies here. They're immune to Chill, so ice plants are a piece of cake for them.
Tip: Not sure how to start? Try dropping a Football Knight Captain in lane 3.
216CustomIZ2-9:
<size=18>Shroomshade 2-9
<size=12><alpha=#03>Best Solution: 475 Sun left
<size=6><alpha=#00>awa
<size=18><alpha=#FF>

















Dancing Pole Vaulter summons four backup dancer vaulters around itself after jumping.
Strong mobility and summoning power - just a bit pricey.
To help you learn it faster, we've marked the lawn with many <u>Lumos Pots.</u>
Try making the Dancing Pole Vaulter jump over the plants on those pots. If you get the order right, this level is quickly solved.
217CustomIZ2-10:
<size=18>Shroomshade 2-10
<size=12><alpha=#02>Best Solution: 625 Sun left
<size=6><alpha=#00>awa
<size=18><alpha=#FF>

















Odyssey plants are back - and there are almost twice as many this time.
Your zombies can't brute-force this. You'll need to outplay them by cleverly abusing the Doom fusions.
Like 2-9, this level also has Lumos Pot hints... but their placement seems completely meaningless...?
<i>' Shroomshade - where light reveals form.'   - Dave Tzu, perhaps
<size=6>
<size=18>
301CustomIZ3：推波助澜:
<size=18>Chapter 3: Making Waves
<size=9>
<size=18>

















The plants seem to have abandoned the lawn and moved their defenses to the pool.
Most zombies can't be placed on water lanes, but Browncoats, Coneheads, and Bucketheads ignore terrain restrictions.
(Soon you'll unlock some zombies built specifically for aquatic combat.)
Chapter Maker: MirteorShower



















<size=9>
302CustomIZ3-1:
<size=18>Making Waves 3-1<size=12>
<alpha=#60>
<alpha=#04>Best Solution: 850 Sun left
<alpha=#00>(Level made by 43056721, edited by MirteorShower)<alpha=#FF><size=18>

















Snorkels can't be targeted by straight-firing plants while underwater. It's perfect for long-distance water infiltration.
It's also a great counter to Squash-nut. Try dropping one directly in lane 4 and see what happens.
Tip: Squash-nuts might still hit Snorkels on fast-forward. If that happens, switch back to normal speed.
303CustomIZ3-2教程:
<size=18>Making Waves 3-2 Tutorial: Endoflame
<size=12>Place zombies in the leftmost column to skip this tutorial.
<alpha=#FF><size=6>
<size=18>

















Endoflame dies and drops a bag of Fertilizer after absorbing 6 projectiles or when its HP drops to 0. (In Puzzle Mode, it won't drop Sun.)
Even though you're playing as zombies, smart Fertilizer usage can help dismantle plant setups. For example:
<u>Fume-shroom + Fertilizer = Gloom-shroom (reduced range).</u>
<u>Scorched Threepeater + Fertilizer = normal Threepeater (halved damage).</u>



















<size=18>
304CustomIZ3-2:
<size=18>Making Waves 3-2<size=12>
<alpha=#60>
<alpha=#04>Best Solution: 775 Sun left
<alpha=#00>>(Level made by 43056721, edited by MirteorShower)<alpha=#FF><size=18>

















Squash Zombie ignores HP and crushes most plants instantly. Tough, high-HP targets? Just let Squash handle it.
You learned some basic Fertilizer tricks in the tutorial, but it can also do things like speed up Chomper digestion.
Though… why would you want Chomper to digest faster? Wouldn't slower be better for us?
305CustomIZ3-3教程:
<size=18>Making Waves 3-3 Tutorial: Nyan Squash
<size=12>Place zombies in the leftmost column to skip this tutorial.
<alpha=#FF><size=6>
<size=18>

















Nyan Squash drops Squash seed packets based on how many zombies she crushes.
You can fuse certain plants with these Squashes to "nerf" them. For example:
<u>Wall-nut + Squash = Squash-nut (leakier defense).</u>   <u>Hypno-shroom + Squash = Hypno Squash (juke-able).</u>
For comparison, place a Football-nut Zombie in column 6 of lane 1 and lane 2.
The one in lane 2 survives and eats the brain. The one in lane 1 does not.



















<size=18>
306CustomIZ3-3:
<size=18>Making Waves 3-3<size=12>
<alpha=#60>(Level made by 树桩上的火炎, edited by MirteorShower)
<alpha=#04>Best Solution: 850 Sun left
<alpha=#00>.<alpha=#FF><size=18>

















<size=9>
<size=18>Beluga Rider Yeti can only be placed in water lanes but vaults an extremely
long distance (4 tiles!) and then turn around to attack plants from behind.
Unsure with which plant to fuse your Squashes? Consider the vanilla plants on the field. (Except Sunflowers)




















<size=9>
307CustomIZ3-4:
<size=18>Making Waves 3-4
<size=12><alpha=#03>Best Solution: 800 Sun left
<size=6><alpha=#00>awa
<size=18><alpha=#FF>

















Endoflame not only provides fertilizer, but can also absorb plant projectiles, reducing the damage zombies take.
In this level, some fertilizer might be redundant, but properly using Endoflame to sponge damage can also help you clear the stage!
Tip: Turn on Plant HP display to check how many more projectiles Endoflame can absorb (blue number).<size=18>
308CustomIZ3-5-1:
<size=18>Making Waves 3-5-1
<size=12><alpha=#00>Best Solution: 950 Sun left
<size=6><alpha=#00>awa
<size=18><alpha=#FF>

















The zombies think you're playing terribly! It looks like they've decided to rely on themselves.
Do nothing. Win. (yes, the next two levels are self-playing stages as well).
Still, we've prepared some backup units at your disposal, just in case something goes wrong...
or if you get bored watching and want to skip ahead.<size=18>
309CustomIZ3-5-2:
<size=18>Making Waves 3-5-2<size=12>
<alpha=#60>(Level made by MirteorShower制作)
<alpha=#00>Best Solution: 0 Sun left
<alpha=#00>.<alpha=#FF><size=18>
Watch this zombie closely →<alpha=#00>-----------------------------------
<alpha=#FF>He's attempting the challenge to eat 5 brains at once. Can he pull it off?<alpha=#00>---------------------------------------------















<alpha=#FF><size=16>Basic Info: Auto stage; fast-forward allowed; Minor plant stacking
Testing shows said Zombie only has about a 70% chance of eating all 5 brains, due to animation variance between zombies and plants (unavoidable).
If he fails to eat all 5 brains, use the Gargantuar in your seed slots to deal with any remaining water-lane,
or simply retry the level and give him another chance.
<size=18>
310CustomIZ3-5-3:
<size=18>Making Waves 3-5-3<size=12>
<alpha=#60>(Level made by 43056721)
<alpha=#00>Best Solution: 800 Sun left
<alpha=#00>.<alpha=#FF><size=18>

















Basic Info: Auto stage; fast-forward not supported; 100% clearance rate at normal speed
May fail to auto-clear if fast-forward is enabled,
so please make sure the game is running at normal speed (full run is approximately 10mins long).
Tip: If you feel the wait is too long, you can place zombies manually to skip the level.
311CustomIZ3-6教程:
<size=18>Making Waves 3-6 Tutorial: Cryo & Pyro Infusions



















Cryo/Pyro Cannons fuse plants affected by the blast with Ice-shroom or Jalapeno. Use this to weaken the plant setup:
<u>Puff-shroom + Ice-shroom = Hail-shroom/<u> <u>Threepeater + 2 Jalapenos = Charred Threepeater</u>
(Many more examples exist, omitted due to space)
<alpha=#FF>Lanes 4 and 5 are a mini-test. If fused correctly, only 4 Browncoats are needed in total for these 2 lanes.
312CustomIZ3-6:
<size=18>Making Waves 3-6
<size=12><alpha=#03>Best Solution: 800 Sun left
<size=6><alpha=#00>awa
<size=18><alpha=#FF>

















Think twice before blasting plants with the Pyro Cannon - most plants actually get stronger after fusing with Jalapeno.
This level also features the Hydrofowl. It ignores HP and crush one water-lane plant, then launch an Imp onto nearby land.
Tip: Tap the far-left side of the screen to cancel cannon aiming.<size=18>
313CustomIZ3-7教程:
<size=18>Making Waves 3-7 Tutorial: Ice-Fire Conflict



















Ice and fire plants are both powerful - but combine them and they'll cancel each other out.
Lane 1's Flame Fume-shroom looks stronger than Lane 2's normal one, but due to ice-fire conflict, it actually deals less total damage.
<alpha=#FF>Mini test for Lanes 4 and 5: fuse correctly and you'll only need <u>2 Football Zombies total</u> to eat both brains.
314CustomIZ3-7:
<size=18>Making Waves 3-7
<size=12><alpha=#03>Best Solution: 750 Sun left
<size=6><alpha=#00>awa

<size=18><alpha=#FF>

















When shooter Zombotanies are chilled, their movement speed is halved - but their attack speed stays the same.
If you find your Zombotanies are walking too fast, try chilling them out with some ice.
<size=18>


















<size=6>
315CustomIZ3-8:
<size=18>Making Waves 3-8<size=12>
<alpha=#60>(Level made by 树桩上的火炎, edited by MirteorShower)
<alpha=#04>Best Solution: 625 Sun left
<alpha=#00>.<alpha=#FF><size=18>

















Spicy Squash Zombie can instantly wipe an entire lane, as long as it isn't chilled. (See the Almanac for details)
<alpha=#FF>Keep it warm. Use fertilizer and ice-fire conflict to prevent it from getting chilled.
Tip: If you're stuck, take a closer look at the plants on Lumos Pots in the lower land lanes.
316CustomIZ3-9:
<size=18>Making Waves 3-9
<size=12><alpha=#03>Best Solution: 475 Sun left
<size=6><alpha=#00>awa
<size=18><alpha=#FF>

















Alright, now the plants are serious. They've planted tons of Thunder Bunnyons along both sides of the road.
Your zombies can't survive many zaps - but only their "captain" can attack, with a 5×5 range. So…
Tap a Thunder Bunnyon to make it Captain. They only attack zombies within the Captain's 5×5 area.</u><size=18>
317CustomIZ3-10:
<size=18>Making Waves 3-10
<size=12><alpha=#03>Best Solution: 600 Sun left
<size=6><alpha=#00>awa
<size=18><alpha=#FF>

















Uh... Something's not right. Were the Thunder Bunnyons arranged like this last level?
No matter who you pick as captain, their attack range always covers Lanes 2 and 5. That shouldn't be possible...
<i>Break the rules.  Fuse to win.   - Dave Tzu, perhaps<size=18>

601CustomIZ1-9B:
<size=18>Lawn of Time 1-9B
<size=12><alpha=#FF>Level Maker: MirteorShower, Best Solution: 400 Sun left
<size=6><alpha=#00>awa
<size=18><alpha=#FF>

















You've entered a B-Side level. The core mechanics are similar to the core main stage, but—
<u>1. Higher difficulty, lower margin for error, and the optimal sun leftover is shown;</u>
<u>2. Expands upon the mechanics of the main stage.</u>
<size=18>These can prove to be a challenge, proceed at your own pace.
602CustomIZ3-6B:
<size=18>Making Waves 3-6B<size=12>
<alpha=#FF>Level Maker: 爱嗑猫薄荷, Best Solution: 525 Sun left
<alpha=#00>Best Solution: 800 Sun left
<alpha=#00>.<alpha=#FF><size=18>

















<size=15>Uh oh. The plants have set up a full-on death trap for the Football Knight Captain.
But wait - they brought Pyro Cannons too? Check the map carefully for fusion opportunities.
Tip: Maybe Twin Solar-nut can help generate more Sun? Maybe hypnotizing a zombie from afar lets others slip through?
